author: punkrokk
body:
If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

brew cask install powershell

Expected behavior
-----------------

Normal prompt. When typing command you can read the text. 

Actual behavior
---------------

Strange behavior when typing commands: 
I just typed the string 'Install'. Below is what happened: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1099386/46085154-5f5b0300-c173-11e8-8906-6456e57ebacb.png)


Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
$<5>
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.1.0
OS                             Darwin 18.0.0 Darwin Kernel Version 18.0.0: Wed Aug 22 20:13:40 PDT 2018; root:xnu-4903.201.2~1/RELEASE_X86_64
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0




```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @punkrokk this doesn't repro for me, can you tell me what terminal you are using and the value of the TERM env var?

title: PS Core on Mac - weird prompt issue PS$<5>$<5>
